ratings.comment: funny proffessor, class was interesting some of the times a lot of video clips. dont know how its possible to not get an A in the class, you would have to try to fail. The tests are hard but all the matters is doing the learning activities and discussions. If you cant get an A you probably should be kicked out of madison.

well if you keep the reader, and go over it along with the slides(that he posts online) before the exam, you'll find that its basically impossible to get less than an AB. just make sure you do the learning activities, blog posts, and clicker-questions.
Adorable man, horrible teacher. Easy to get an A with all of the opportunities but stressful to get them done. DO NOT BUY THE READER. Completely useless!

Although Bland is a funny guy this was probably the worst class I have ever taken. Material is boring. Test are incomprehensible. His mult. choice questions are A-F and sound all the same. The only good thing is that points are all equal so do the Learning Activities, go to lecture; even if you fail every test (which I did) you can still get a B.

Bill Bland is a funny guy and he keeps you entertained w/ boring material. But he explains things weirdly which makes for really confusing slides and test questions. I found his MC and clickr questions killer. But he makes it easy to get an A in the class. No need to buy the Reader that goes along w/ the textbook. Must show up for Clickr Q points.

Professor Bland makes it pretty hard to fail this class. He's goofy, makes obscure references which I enjoyed ("Let's grok this out...") and he knows the subject matter. I didn't like that the homework required a lot of time in front of the computer, which is the only reason I won't be getting an A. Clicker questions=attendance points

It's not hard to do well in this class, but... It's a class about water. Probably the most boring course I will ever take at the UW. However, for non-science students this is a great class with little outside work. Take the tests seriously, show up for class, and do the learning activities and you can't possibly get less than an AB.

very easy to get an A and he makes it an effort to give A's, you just hafta show up for clicker q's, to learning activities, and get at least 20 on each midterm. the final exam is optional. bland is great! :)

This class is an easy A. As long as you go to the lectures and do the learning activities it's not hard at all. Also Bland is funny and pretty much knows that nobody there really cares about the class, but he still makes it fun. Read the course reader before exams and you'll do fine.

Bland is hilarious. He knows that everyone in his class just to fill the requirement, but he still has fun with teaching. The way his points system works, it's impossible to do poorly unless you actually try. AB with NO effort, seriously. Great class for non-science people.
Exams are DIFFICULT; however, like every UW course the class is curved. Stop freaking out freshman!

EASY A. Exam averages were sometimes a bit low, but this does not mean they were D's. People do not understand curves. Do all the learning activities and go to lecture, and the class is a cinch. 110 points possible, 95 and up is an A, and 24 of the points are Learning Activites, which are a piece of cake. Exams are NOT hard. Easy, easy, easy A.

The class is a cinch...no final if you do well on the first three exams...and do the learning activities!  Grades are based on total points...which makes it easy to know how well you have to do on each exam to get the grade you want!  Easy A.
The problem with this class is not so much that the material is boring, but the exam questions are entirely too specific. When the average on the tests are Ds, you know something is wrong.

Professor Bland is not a terrible instructor but there are guest lecturers (specifically Dr. Matilde Urrutia) who are NOT good. The exams were horribly written, which gave me almost no incentive to attend class or do the readings. I learned more by doing the simple learning activities homework than from all the lectures combined. Avoid this class.

This class is a joke.  The actual professor doesn't teach half the time, and all the material is presented very uncreatively.  The avg on the first test was a C, the second was an F, and the last was either a C or a D.  It's not curved because you can drop one test, but what professor would want over half their class failing? Do not take.

Avoid like the plague!! Used to be an easy class, now near impossible due to incompetent TAs who teach the class - class average on recent test was 55%-they decided NOT to curve it-most poorly written test I have ever seen, and the only test I have failed, ever. Take AOS 120 (Oceanography) instead with Harold Tobin, SO much better

this class was not as easy as everyone says, i took it to take an easy science, but they changed the format and it really isn't that easy, we just had a test and the class AVERAGE was a 54%, this class is not an easy A, it might be an easy AB or B though if that's what you're looking for

This class (Soil Science 132) is not difficult.  There are few readings, and while some of the lecturers aren't perfect, Prof. Bland is very entertaining.  Outside assignments make an A easily attainable.

This class is NOT easy. Going to lecture is basically useless because there are like 100 different professors and few of them make sense. Bland is a nice guy, but the tests are literally impossible and the grading scale is ****ED UP. only take this class if you're willing to put in a lot of work.

This class is both easy and interesting.  I found Prof Bland to be funny and entertaining during class, and friendly and reasonable one on one.  The topic is also fairly interesting.  I do have comlaints about this class, though.  1. Too many lecturers other than Bland.  He was the best.  2. Too many coasties who talk the whole time. Why even come?

Very easy class. Do the learning activities, go to most classes, look at the short readings, and study for a couple hours before each exam and you'll have an A. Barely worked for this class. I definitely recommend it if you need science credits!

Class is very straight foward, go to class and write down what he puts on the projector.  Study that material and a few of the readings and you are set for the test.  He goes of a point system, and if you do the assignments and do decent on the exams there is no final.  Take it if you need a science credit

dont screw around like i did in this class. if u do the learning activities and know the packet information youre fine. he's not very organized or clear in class, but means well. tests are harder than u expect.DO THE LEARNING ACTIVITIES! i got a BC bc i didnt put the work in it i should have. just take it seriously and ull have an A no prob

Great class with a lot of opportunities to get an A. I highly recommend it; only make sure to take the tests seriously, they are pretty difficult. Other than that, do all the learning activities and you'll get your A.

Class is cake if you show up 75% of the time.  Basically no textbook; tests are challenging but so many leway points are given that you dont' even have to do that well.  topic is actually pretty interesting

This class is not a joke.  Do not blow off the exams because it will hurt you in the end.  The exams are hard to understand and you NEED to study for them (especially if you are terrible at science). Go to every lecture   and know everything he says.

This is the easiest class at this university. Professor Bland is a very nice guy and cares about the students.  His lectures can get a little long sometimes, and he occasionally brings in guest speakers.  Go to lecture, do the learning activities, and you will not be  guaranteed an A.
Easiest class offered at UW.  Funny guy who likes what he does.  Optional final which can only help your grade.
THE EASIEST CLASS IN UW!  Great professor...you can get 65% on your 5 exams...he only counts 4...and you can still get an A.
This may be the easiest class ever offered at UW. The class is bland as is his name but it is almost impossible to get less then an A.

This is a must take class for an easy A. He is funny occationally, extremely dry humor. I feel sorry for him for because its really a high school course. Hes a really nice guy. There are also a ton of atheletes enrolled so it must be easy.
